primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God is executing an apocalyptic war to redeem the entire cosmos from the bondage of decay, using the Church as a participant in His suffering and eventual triumph.

tekstueel_bewijs: God’s plan for redeeming and transforming the world.
God’s purpose, which cannot fail, is to restore the creation.
The Lord of nature will return to restore his creation.

object.identificatie: The Redemption of the Cosmos (The 'Universal Frame')
tekstueel_bewijs: the creation itself will be set free from its bondage to decay
the glorious liberty of the children of God

ontvanger.identificatie: The Creation and the Baptized (Emily, Catherine, the Church)
tekstueel_bewijs: the creation itself will be set free
receiving all the benefits of his divine life

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Church (as suffering agent)
tekstueel_bewijs: It is the Spirit that makes the Christian life happen
through the agency of his church as it suffers on behalf of that creation
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the pattern/mediator.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Devil (Cosmic Powers)
tekstueel_bewijs: engagement with the forces of sin, evil, and death
the powers of sin, death, and the devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but ontological 'futility' and 'bondage' that requires a divine 'apocalyptic war' to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The baptized life: The Christian (S) follows Christ into suffering (O) to witness to the coming glory.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Baptized (The Hearer)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/suffering) is explicitly nested within the primary program (God's victory). We suffer because we are joined to the Victor.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord of nature will return
God will do as he fulfills his promise
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we too might walk in newness of life
we wait for it with endurance

voorbeelden: being joined to Christ... means sharing with him in his sufferings
our deepest instinct is to want to protect
empowerment for a life of joyful service
the source of our baptismal strength

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that enables the 'Devoir' (Duty) of the Christian. The ability to suffer is a 'gift' or 'empowerment' rather than a mere command.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Suffering/Futility) to ~S2 (Waiting in hope) and finally to S1 (The coming triumph of God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the Resurrection of Christ, which is the 'prefigurement' of the cosmic S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon uses the example of a fatally ill child to ensure S2 is not trivialized.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. While it calls for human action (suffering with Christ), it grounds this entirely in God's prior and coming action. The 'Subject' of the cosmic restoration is God, not human effort.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I believe because the extraordinary lives of Christians like Dietrich Bonhoeffer...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s purpose, which cannot fail, is to restore the creation.
fight under his banner against sin, the world, and the devil

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Figures like Bonhoeffer and the Holmes family are used, but not as 'models to imitate' by will, but as 'evidence' of God's power working in weakness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by focusing on 'Christ in majesty' as the source of their strength.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Consolation and empowerment; moving from anxiety for the children to trust in God's victory.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the baptism of infants to the cosmic redemption of Romans 8 is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'no evidence' (skepticism) and 'reasons for faith'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: St. Michael the Archangel will have defeated the powers of sin, death, and the devil.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (the ability to walk in newness of life).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is a 'bondage to decay' affecting the entire universe, not just individual mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative. Human action is correctly positioned as a 'Secondary Program' enabled by the 'Primary Program' of Grace.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Savoir (reasons to believe)
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The 'reasons I believe' section is rhetorically effective but structurally shifts to the human 'I'. It is balanced by the 'Christ in Majesty' conclusion.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats the opponent (death/futility) with appropriate gravity.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterpiece of theocentric preaching that uses the Actantial Model perfectly to ground human suffering in divine victory.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'tiptoe' metaphor; Greimas shows that the metaphor functions to position the Cosmos as a 'Receiver' of God's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 8; semiotics shows how the sermon casts the modern congregation into the same functional roles as the Roman Christians.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'suffering' of the Christian is not a 'work' to earn glory, but a 'modal competence' (Pouvoir) granted by the Spirit.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by framing human endurance as 'being held on to' by God.
